intro: Spergularia marcelii, commonly known as the marsh sandwort, is a low-growing, flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant thrives in moist, sandy soils, often found in coastal dunes or wet meadows. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Spergularia marcelii is adapted to salt spray and is an important component of coastal ecosystems.
